channel.title: Run Problem!
channel.description: ok i get this problem when i run my server( Delta) [URL=http://img440.imageshack.us/i/idkdkfkdfkstg4567.jpg/][IMG]http://img440.imageshack.us/img440/2589/idkdkfkdfkstg4567.jpg[/img][/URL]

item.title: Run Problem!
item.description:
@11167 wrote:

[quote=“Goran, post:24, topic:287871”][quote author=_ link=topic=380583.msg2860772#msg2860772 date=1247150359]
Or, just add ‘special.java’ and in it make this:
public class special {

public special() { }

}

That’ll solve your problems.
[/quote]i added it but still errors[/quote]

You’re not getting errors if you do it right.

You obviously need a special.java with those methods within them in order to clear the errors, and special must be defined in your server class as well.

Read full topic

item.title: Run Problem!
item.dc:creator: @Goran Goran
item.description:
@Goran wrote:

[quote=“Vira_, post:28, topic:287871”][quote author=The Soul link=topic=380583.msg2860790#msg2860790 date=1247150828]

Change

special special = new special();

to

public special special = new special();

Why would he do that, he hasn’t got a special class file.

Or, just add ‘special.java’ and in it make this:
public class special {

public special() { }

}

That’ll solve your problems.
[/quote]i added it but still errors

Do as I said, this will fix your problems.

I didn’t really pay attention to the post. He was trying to initialize a constructer to whose name wasn’t the same as the class’, which would result in errors. So you need the public modifier.

I realized that when you posted, Goran, do as I said and remove the things what I said.[/quote]dude i now have 8 fucking errors

Read full topic

item.title: Run Problem!
item.dc:creator: @Vira Vira_
item.description:
@Vira wrote:

Well, if you can’t find special.java go back to your server.java and delete the following.

public static special special = null;
special special = new special();
special = new special();

You might not have all of them, but try searching for them.
